Question
========
```{r echo=FALSE, fig.retina=2, fig.cap="", message=FALSE, results='asis' }

# This is the code to get the optimal level of x and y in the perfect substitutes

# U =a x1 + b x2

d <- {d}
r <- {r}

px <- {px}
py <- {py}
I <- {I}
 

# Compare p1/p2 with a/b
if(px/py > d/r) {
  y <- I/py
  x <- 0
} else if(px/py < d/r) {
  x<- I/px
  y <- 0
}

# 
#extol: `r 0.05*x`
#cat("The comp x1 is:", x1c, "\n")

extol_value <- 0.05 * x
extol_value <- round(extol_value, 2) # Optional: round to desired precision
```

The consumer's utility function is the following: 

$U=$ `r d` {x} $+$ `r r` {y}

The price of {x} is \$`r px`, the price of {y} is \$`r py`, and the income of the consumer is \$`r format(I, scientific=FALSE)`

What is the optimal amount of {x} that the consumer will purchase?

Solution
========
`r format(round(x, 2), scientific = FALSE)`
